name: Kvosin Downtown Hotel

reviews.title: Beware Saturday nights
reviews.text: My room (102) was nice: good cooking/dinning aisle with all the necessary kitchen appliances and coffee machine, small bedroom section but with a comfortable bed, black and white bathroom.

reviews.title: Best location in Reyjkavik
reviews.text: Friendly and efficient reception making swiftly all necessary arrangements ( taxi, contacts with tour operators etc ). Close to the central street and Islandic Excursions, nice wine bar next to the hotel entrance. Free WiFi. Very efficient no key system, where you open your door with a code.

reviews.title: We have been all over the world we loved this hotel
reviews.text: I stayed only 1 night however i would like to emphasize some areas for enhancement:

reviews.title: Great experience!
reviews.text: - no phone in the rooms. When I needed help by the reception at 1:20 AM - noisy visitors preventing me from sleeping ( beware of Saturday nights in Reykjavik!) right in front of my door - I realized that there is no way to call reception. I sent an e-mail hoping it will be seen. And it was. Within 3 minutes I got the confirmation that my problem will be looked into and 5 minutes later the problem was solved. Apparently, as I learnt the next morning, mobile phones are available at the reception.

reviews.title: Hotel devoid of management
reviews.text: - no wardrobe. There are 2 shelves and some hangers. If you plan to stay for a few nights and unpack, check if adequate rooms are available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my wife to Iceland for our Anniversary and stayed at Kvosin Downtown Hotel for a long weekend. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - the attention to detail is really amazing. The size of the rooms were incredibly comfortable, it even had a small kitchenette that allowed us to have snacks and a few cold drinks before heading out for the evening. The location of the hotel is great - you can easily walk to fine dining, cafes, wine bars and tourist sights.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms and a unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to assist us in everything that we needed. The complimentary breakfast is served in a really cozy cafe next door. The breakfast we had included some of the most amazing humus I've ever tried, delicious prosciutto, fresh baked bread, scrambled eggs, yogurt and other great treats.
reviews.title: Charming, comfy, & chic

reviews.text: If I were to visit Iceland again, I would definitely stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel that feels like home

reviews.text: A bunch of us stayed at Kvosin Downtown Hotel while in Reykjavik for a wedding celebration early June. Hotel is brand new and boasts impeccable style. Rooms we occupied were either for 2 or 4 people and are spacious with plenty of hang-out area and comfortable beds. Newly-weds held a gathering in the penthouse and (to no one's surprise) it is indeed the best room to chill in. The two terraces offer amazing views and are big enough to probably host the whole town.
reviews.title: Go see, stay & enjoy

reviews.text: Location -wise hotel is smack in the centre of Reykjavik, so don't even think twice about it. Breakfast is served at a cute coffee shop adjacent to the hotel and it was delicious.
reviews.title: Best hotel in R.

reviews.text: Enough said ... clearly a no-brainer. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel, Staff and a must stay!
Modern and yet rustic decor, great location!
reviews.text: A small newly opened design hotel in top location of Reykjavik. Very comfortable beds, nice bathroom and high quality in all details. The service of f&b was non existing when we visited but a Vine Bar were supposed to open in mid july. Breakfast was served in a small neighbor Restaurant and was quite OK. The system with codes in stead of room keys is brilliant. Room rates are high but may be acceptable when all service in-house are up running. Must be the best hotel in R.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I stayed at the Kvosin hotel this past weekend as we celebrated a birthday. We had 4 rooms and the top suite was unbelievable. With 2 rooms (1 double bed / bunkbed in the other), an amazing stereo system and 2 spectacular Patios. I was told by the locals that it likely was the best hotel room in Reykavik. The staff were amazing and a special shout out to Emilio! They are completing a new restaurant which will be the cherry topping on the cake. The restaurant that they currently use, provided a delightful breakfast and lunch if you chose to eat there. I would recommend this hotel to everyone far and wide. The location is perfect right next to Hotel Borg and no more than 5 minutes to anyplace that you need to get to in the heart of Reykavik! A magnificent spot!
reviews.title: CHIC-est Boutique Hotel in Reykjavik!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented the entire hotel for our destination wedding in Iceland and having everyone at Kvosin was one of the highlights. Because we had the whole place, I can you we've seen the insides of every room and there isn't one bad room in this place. The finishing is all of the highest quality and finest taste. Comfortable beds, beautiful bathrooms, Aveda products, and scrumptious breakfast every morning at Bergsson downstairs. The newly opened hotel had service beyond 5 stars and location is incredible, right in the heart of charming Reykjavik. All attractions are within easy walking distance. For those of you wishing to impress and throw a party/gathering, Suite 401 covers the entire top floor and boasts 2 unbelievable balconies, totaling 1000 sq ft. We can't thank Kvosin and it's amazing manager Birgir enough for the hospitality and for going out of their way to make this a memorable stay for all of us and our guests. We had an overflow of guests who had to stay at other locations and I think they were all jealous of what they saw at Kvosin. We will definitely return to Iceland at some point and will stay here again and recommend it to all our friends without a doubt. Amazing place.
reviews.title: There isn't one bad room at Kvosin

reviews.text: Our service at the hotel was excellent. The staff goes out of their way to help you find or do anything. It was newly remodeled and they did an excellent job. The location is in a convenient place downtown. What we liked was the home like atmosphere.
reviews.title: John and Audery

reviews.text: The hotel is a great location... right downtown! Highly recommended it! Downtown area is in walking distance and travel center near by to plan day trips. The staff was very helpful and able to answer all questions. Cute breakfast place attached to the hotel with amazing food! Can't go wrong if you stay here!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Classy, spacious newly renovated hotel with all the bells and whistles, large rooms makes it easy to open suitcases and relax while still having plenty of room to move around. While in your room it is deigned so there space to gather with friends/family to make plans. Location is perfect for all the nearby resturants and shops. Rooms have accomodations to prepare simple meals in your room or dine in the restaurant through the courtyard. Staff is very helpful with any arrangements that you may need. A gem that would truly be a great find for any guest.
reviews.title: European experience in Iceland

reviews.text: We stayed at the Kvosin Downtown Hotel for four nights, with a Family group. We really enjoyed. It was a very nice newly remodeled. Rooms were very comfortable. It is a great location, just behind Parliament Building and Cathedral. The employees all were very helpful and the service in restaurant was very good not to mention the food which was very good. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Hotel that is as comfortable as home

description: Kvosin is located in the heart of Reykjavík. And by heart, I mean heart, not kidney, spleen or thyroid. In less then three minutes walking distance are cafés, bars, clubs, museums, Harpa (concerts and conventions), the mayor, ducks and politicians working in the Icelandic parliament next door (nevermind).Let's see. I've got Normal rooms, Bigger rooms, Biggest rooms and Larger than life rooms but only one Tiny room. I'm inspired by my experience as a traveller: I want a good bed, I want to cook, I want to watch big TV, I want to bring my friends or kids, I want space and I want fun. So, here you are.
